name: pliability
content:
pliability noun [U]
(of a substance)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to bend easily into a new shape without breaking or cracking, or the degree to which a substance can do this: The plastic dolls have unusual pliability. These mats have a pliability that allows them to be rolled and used as a funnel.
More examplesFewer examplesThis product gives the hold of a gel with the pliability of a wax.The pages are of a thickness that gives pliability and easy separation while maintaining economy in bulk and weight.Anything that alters the pliability of the vocal membranes impairs the voice.

pliability noun [U]
(of a person)
often disapproving the quality of being easily influenced and controlled by other people, or the degree to which someone is like this: Some people took advantage of his pliabiliy. He has a happy mixture of pliability and perseverence in his nature.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has a reputation for pliability.The politician expects the same pliability in others that he exhibits in himself.I thought I had done well to show pliability on the matter.
